intro: Agrostemma apetalum, commonly known as the naked-stamen lousewort, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Oenotheraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that lack petals. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and waste areas. Its flowers are usually pink to reddish in color and feature prominent stamens that are visible even when the petals are absent. Agrostemma apetalum is an annual herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
